verses.verse: For this is the message that you heard from the beginning, ((John 13:34; 15:12); 1 John 4:7, 11, 21; 2 John 5) that we should love one another,
not as (Gen. 4:4, 8) Cain who was of the wicked one and murdered his brother. And why did he murder him? Because his works were evil and his brother’s righteous.
Do not marvel, my brethren, if ((John 15:18; 17:14)) the world hates you.
We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the brethren. He who does not love his brother abides in death.
(Matt. 5:21; John 8:44) Whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that ((Gal. 5:20, 21; Rev. 21:8)) no murderer has eternal life abiding in him.
(The Outworking of Love) ((John 3:16)) By this we know love, (John 10:11; 15:13; Gal. 2:20) because He laid down His life for us. And we also ought to lay down our lives for the brethren.
But (Deut. 15:7) whoever has this world’s goods, and sees his brother in need, and shuts up his heart from him, how does the love of God abide in him?
My little children, (Ezek. 33:31) let us not love in word or in tongue, but in deed and in truth.
And by this we know (John 18:37) that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before Him.
((1 Cor. 4:4, 5)) For if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart, and knows all things.
Beloved, if our heart does not condemn us, ((Heb. 10:22; 1 John 2:28; 5:14)) we have confidence toward God.
And (Ps. 34:15; (John 15:7); 1 John 5:14, 15) whatever we ask we receive from Him, because we keep His commandments (John 8:29; Heb. 13:21) and do those things that are pleasing in His sight.
And this is His commandment: that we should believe on the name of His Son Jesus Christ (Matt. 22:39) and love one another, as He gave us commandment.

(The Spirit of Truth and the Spirit of Error) Now (John 14:23) he who keeps His commandments (John 14:21; 17:21) abides in Him, and He in him. And (John 14:17; Rom. 8:9, 14, 16; 1 Thess. 4:8; 1 John 4:13) by this we know that He abides in us, by the Spirit whom He has given us.
Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but (1 Cor. 14:29) test the spirits, whether they are of God; because (Matt. 24:5) many false prophets have gone out into the world.
By this you know the Spirit of God: ((Rom. 10:8-10); 1 Cor. 12:3; 1 John 5:1) Every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is of God,

and every spirit that does not confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not of God. And this is the spirit of the Antichrist, which you have heard was coming, and is now already in the world.
You are of God, little children, and have overcome them, because He who is in you is greater than (John 14:30; 16:11) he who is in the world.
(John 3:31) They are of the world. Therefore they speak as of the world, and (John 15:19; 17:14) the world hears them.
We are of God. He who knows God hears us; he who is not of God does not hear us. ((1 Cor. 2:12-16)) By this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.
(Knowing God Through Love) (1 John 3:10, 11, 23) Beloved, let us love one another, for love is of God; and everyone who (1 Thess. 4:9; (1 John 3:14)) loves is born of God and knows God.
